intro: Cuellaria, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apocynaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their milky sap, which is often toxic. Cuellaria species typically have opposite, simple leaves and produce showy, tubular flowers in various colors, including yellow, orange, and red. They are often found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value and others for their ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
